question: The "Lake Zway" is located in which country?
explanation: The Lake Zway is one of the freshwater Rift Valley Lakes of Ethiopia. Meki River and Katar River form the primary inflows of this lake and Bulbar River forms the primary outflow. The shores of this lake were inhabited by the Zay people which also supports a thriving fishing industry. This lake is also home to several islands in which one of those islands housed a monastery around the 9th century which kept the "Ark of the Covenant".
